item.title: “If You Could Go Anywhere In the World, Where Would You Go?” Topic of November 6 Fulbright Info Session
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Want to complete your thesis or dissertation research, earn a graduate degree, or teach English in one of 140 countries? Students with a bachelor’s degree who are ready to travel in the Fall of 2026 are encouraged to register or drop by to attend this session discussing how to select and apply for a Fulbright Award….

item.title: RPIrates Monthly Meeting: “Linux Shell Expansion for R Dummies” (Weds, 30 Oct, 6p, AE217)
item.description: Stepping into the Land of Linux is unavoidable for serious data analysts, and a mastery of the command line is a definite superpower for R users. Shell expansion enables Linux users to generate complex commands and manipulate data efficiently. In this discussion we’ll use the echo command explore various types of expansions. Whether you’re just starting out or want to solidify your understanding, this RPIrates discussion should help you leverage shell expansion in your data analytics journey!

item.title: “I Dream” to Offer Powerful Tribute to the Civil Rights Movement
item.description: In partnership with Rensselaer, the Musical Dramatic Arts Foundation is proud to present a concert version of the groundbreaking musical “I Dream.” The special performance, which will take place in the EMPAC Theater on November 1, aims to reach both the broader community as well as Rensselaer students, faculty and staff.

item.title: United Way to Hold Election Day Barbeque Fund Raiser
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 5, 2024 2:30 PM - 5:30 PM - In conjunction with Sodexho, the Rensselaer United Way Campaign will hold an Election Day chicken barbeque fund raiser, featuring your choice of a full takeout-only meal for only $16! Please contact any of the United Way committee members to purchase your dinner(s) and also let them know what time you will pick up your food at EMPAC. Dinners must be paid in advance by cash, or with a check made to Rensselaer, by noon Tuesday, October 29.

item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Attend this seminar for a presentation by Dr. Ruogang Zhao, Associate Professor of Biomedical Engineering at the University at Buffalo, who will be discussing “Engineered fibrotic tissue models for disease modeling and drug testing.” Please RSVP by October 28 with Gigi Felch to secure your spot!

item.title: “Allyship in Action” Panel Event to be Held October 30
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM - All Rensselaer students, staff, faculty, and alumni are invited to take part in this virtual Webex event to hear from a panel of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ+) individuals from the Rensselaer community as they discuss the meaning and importance of allyship, and how to help create safe and supportive communities for LGBTQ+ individuals.
